pageContext.claim: “Plus, if you notice, they’re trying to hire thousands of judges so every person that walks across — and they’re taught to say the right thing — they walk across, and then they go and they’re supposed to go to court.”
pageContext.analysis: This is eerily similar to a claim from Attorney General Jeff Sessions when he claimed that "dirty immigration lawyers" were coaching their clients to cite credible fear as the reason they were crossing the border. But here's the thing. The data show that people from Central America, where violence and humanitarian abuses have surged, make up most of the credible fear claims. About 80 percent of the time, a trained immigration official ruled that the cases are legitimate, requiring a court ruling. Trump's claim on judges doesn't make sense as federal judges are confirmed — so Congress would do the hiring.
